perturbation.original_text:
2.1 For the term of this Agreement, Tripath appoints Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor for the Products in the Territory, subject to Tripath's direct sales activities under Section 4.

2.2 Distributor will use best efforts to develop the local market and promote the sales of Products within the Territory. Distributor will not sell outside the Territory without Tripath's prior written permission, which will not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.1 For the term of this Agreement, Tripath appoints Vendor as a non-exclusive distributor for the Products in the Territory, subject to Tripath's direct sales activities under Section 4.

2.2 Distributor will use best efforts to develop the local market and promote the sales of Products within the Territory. Distributor will not sell outside the Territory without Tripath's prior written permission, which will not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.explanation: The contract now refers to the 'Distributor' in section 2.2 and 'Vendor' in section 2.1, creating uncertainty regarding which entity is bound by which obligation. It's unclear if they're the same entity or if Tripath has appointed two different entities, each with distinct responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text:
3.1 Distributor will maintain an adequately trained sales organization, capable of fulfilling its obligation under Subsection 2.2.

3.2 Tripath will furnish technical and marketing information (such as sales aids and
perturbation.changed_text:
3.1 Reseller will maintain an adequately trained sales organization, capable of fulfilling its obligation under Subsection 2.2.

3.2 Tripath will furnish technical and marketing information (such as sales aids and
perturbation.explanation: Section 3.1 now uses 'Reseller' instead of 'Distributor'. This introduces ambiguity as to whether 'Reseller' refers to the same entity as 'Distributor', leading to confusion about who is obligated to maintain the sales organization.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 Tripath may in its sole discretion, immediately upon written notice to Distributor, make direct sales to certain accounts in the Territory ("Direct Sales Accounts"), including accounts to which Distributor has made sales.

6.1 Prices for Products will be as set forth in the then effective distributor price list ("Distributor Price List") which will be furnished to Distributor from time to time.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 Tripath may in its sole discretion, immediately upon written notice to Partner, make direct sales to certain accounts in the Territory ("Direct Sales Accounts"), including accounts to which Distributor has made sales.

6.1 Prices for Products will be as set forth in the then effective distributor price list ("Distributor Price List") which will be furnished to Distributor from time to time.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 5.1, 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Partner', while Section 6.1 still uses 'Distributor'. This misaligned terminology raises questions about the scope of Tripath's direct sales rights and the pricing applicable to different entities.
